body.div:
If you need to talk or are concerned about someone, please call 1.800.273.TALK (8255)
If you need extra help due to the COVID-19 outbreak, we provide a list of resources here. Close Top Banner

div.p: Know the Signs. Save a Life.

a.span: Past Texas Suicide Prevention Symposium Presentations
Texas Fact Sheets for Suicide Prevention
Media Guidelines for Covering a Death by Suicide
Suicide Prevention and Postvention Data Sources
Clinical Trials Related to Suicide Prevention
Texas Health and Human Services Commission

div.p: In light of the recent events, the need for us to pull together and help those struggling is at an all time high as isolation and the stresses produced during this time of rapid transition is dealt with. Below is a collection of resources for both those in the mental health community and those working in various sectors looking for resources to help understand what they can do to help prevent suicide.

div.class: kt-accordion-wrap kt-accordion-wrap kt-accordion-id_7d404d-25 kt-accordion-has-7-panes kt-active-pane-0 kt-accordion-block kt-pane-header-alignment-left kt-accodion-icon-style-arrow kt-accodion-icon-side-right

p.br: Connect with others who are living with or supporting someone who lives with mental illness, substance use, or a stressful life event
A social support network with more than 220 condition-specific groups
Specialized support group resources and tips for finding the right group for you
Support groups for peers (Connection Support Group) and family members (Family Support Group)

div.p: A Guide for Community and Industry Leaders: Lethal Means Safety & Suicide Prevention
A Toolkit for Senior Centers: Promoting Emotional Health and Preventing Suicide

p.strong: Una Guía para Centros de Atención de Adultos Mayores:
p.a: CÓMO PROMOVER LA SALUD EMOCIONAL Y PREVENIR EL SUICIDIO

li.a: Supporting your mental health while navigating change
Taking care of your mental health in the face of uncertainty

span.strong: Links (Guidelines, resources from other organizations and more)

p.br: Simple CDC guidelines for preventing the spread of coronavirus
Contains social media banners for mental health awareness, articles and videos discussing mental health in light of Covid-19 and guides and how to offer support.

div.p: NAMI Texas COVID Resources (significant online support group information): https://namitexas.org/coronavirus/

Texas Counseling Association COVID-19 Page: https://txca.org/news/coronavirus_covid-19_resourc.php
Contains a significant number tele-mental health resources

p.strong: National Association of Social Workers – Texas Chapter – COVID-19 Resources

li.a: Texas Health Commissioner Declares Public Health Disaster (Added 3/20/20)

Medicare Telemedicine Health Care Provider Fact Sheet (3/20/20)

div.p: Texas Health and Human Services (Texas Dept of State Health) COVID-19: https://dshs.texas.gov/coronavirus/

p.strong: TexVet and Military Veteran Peer Network.
Texas Education Agency Support and Guidance

div.p: Texas suicide prevention news & resources - not crisis/clinical support. For help -911 or National Lifeline-800-273-8255. DONATE at https://t.co/CTAA8OFuVG
StopTXSuicides Daily Suicide Prevention Summary: https://paper.li/StopTXSuicides/1386786835?edition_id=676f70f0-897f-11ea-9656-002590a5ba2d Stories via @SPRCtweets @JDANKS420 @800273TALK
We can work together to support #Texans! Help and hope is available, 24/7 at @distressline @800273TALK. Reach out! #Texas #CONNECT
